vaccinepage.title: Verification Quick Response (QR) Code
vaccinepage.subtitle: Please fill out the form to create quick response (QR) code

dashboardpage.content1: Welcome to the Digital COVID-19 Verification Record system. Enter a few details below to get a link to a QR code and digital copy of your COVID-19 verification record. If you want to share proof of vaccination, you can use either the electronic or a printed version of the record you’ll get from the system. We recommend waiting 3-7 days for your new dose to show up in the Immunization Registry before requesting a link. Once you click submit, you can expect to receive your link automatically within the next 24 hours. The link expires 24 hours after it is sent, so please save, download, or print your record.
dashboardpage.content2: People within a family may have multiple verification records associated with a single phone number or email address, enter each digital verification record request separately.
dashboardpage.content3: The system provides a digital copy of state vaccine records. If you received your vaccinations from a federal agency (Department of Defense, Indian Health Services, or Veterans Affairs), you will need to contact those agencies for assistance.
dashboardpage.content4: If you have questions about your Digital COVID-19 Verification Record, visit the <1>Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)</1>.

vaccineform.filloutheader: Please fill out the required fields to receive a link to a QR code / digital copy of your COVID-19 Verification Record:
vaccineform.filloutsubheader: <0>Note:</0> Once you click submit, you can expect to receive your link automatically within the next 24 hours.
vaccineform.title: Patient Information
vaccineform.subtitle: Required fields marked with *
vaccineform.phoneemailinfo: Provide a mobile phone or email that may be associated with your vaccine record. If you do not get a match using your mobile phone, try again using your email address.
vaccineform.pincode: Create a 4-digit PIN number. You'll receive a link to enter the PIN number and access your digital vaccine record. *
vaccineform.pinErrorMsg3: Your PIN is not correct. Please try again.
vaccineform.pinErrorMsg4: Please try your request again in 1 minute.
vaccineform.pinErrorMsg5: Please contact us or your healthcare provider for more information or support.
vaccineform.pinErrorMsg6: We could not complete your request, please try again.
vaccineform.pinErrorMsg7: Invalid data format, please try again
vaccineform.note: <0>Note:</0> Your PIN is needed to securely access your digital record.
vaccineform.besent: be sent to you, so please ensure you write it down for future use.
vaccineform.notedescription: this code will not be sent to you, so please ensure you write down for future use.
vaccineform.checkboxdescription: By checking this box, you are declaring under penalty of perjury under state and federal laws that you are the Patient or Parent/Guardian of the Patient and are therefore authorized to access the Patient’s immunization record.
vaccineform.safe: Safe, free, and effective COVID-19 vaccines are now available. Please visit our <1>COVID vaccine webpage</1> to see if you or your child is eligible
vaccineform.enterPin: Please enter the PIN code you created to request access to your vaccine record.

qrpage.title: Personal Digital COVID-19 Verification Record
qrpage.name: Name
qrpage.minrequirementsandroid: Minimum requirements: Android version 5 and Google Play Services version 21.18 & above.
qrpage.minrequirementsios: Minimum requirements: On an iOS device, use Safari web browser.
qrpage.incorrect: If the information on your digital vaccine record is incorrect or missing a dose, has wrong dates or incorrect brand, you may need to correct or update your immunization record. You can contact your provider to update your record or <1>contact us</1>. You will be notified of our findings and remediation actions within 2-3 weeks.

receivedpage.title: Digital COVID-19 Verification Record Request Receipt
receivedpage.content1: Your request has been received. If the information provided matches the information in our system, you will receive a link to access your COVID-19 verification record.
receivedpage.content2: If you do not receive a link within 24 hours, please try again and make sure your name, date of birth, phone or email match the information provided at the time of your vaccination.
receivedpage.content3: If you have questions about the <1>Digital COVID-19 Verification Record</1>, we have answers. Visit our <3>Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)</3>.

faqpage.title: WA Verify FAQ
faqpage.01question: What is a Digital COVID-19 Verification Record?
faqpage.01answer: Your <1>Digital COVID-19 Verification Record</1> is an electronic vaccination record drawn from the data stored in the state immunization registry. The digital record shows the same information as your paper CDC COVID-19 vaccine card: your name, date of birth, vaccination dates and type of vaccine you received. The digital record also includes a QR code that when scanned by a SMART Health Card reader will display to the reader your name, date of birth, vaccine dates and vaccine type. The QR code also confirms the vaccine record as an official record of your state.
faqpage.02question: How will my verification record be delivered?
faqpage.02answer: When your verification record is found, you will receive a link delivered to the email or mobile phone number associated with the vaccination record. After entering your four-digit PIN, you will see your COVID-19 verification information including your name, date of birth, vaccination date(s), and vaccine manufacturer. You will also receive a scannable QR code confirming your verification record is authentic.
faqpage.03question: Can I save my digital verification record on an iPhone?
faqpage.03answer: <0>You can save your Digital verification record to the Apple Health app with the iOS 15 operating system. You will need to use your Safari web browser to complete the process. </0>
faqpage.04question: Can I save my Digital verification record on an Android device?
faqpage.04answer: <0>Yes. You can save your <1>Digital COVID-19 Verification Record</1> to Google Pay if you have Android version 5 and Google Play Services version 21.18 or above. </0>
faqpage.05question: If I get additional doses, will they show on my digital verification record?
faqpage.05answer: <0>No. If you receive an additional dose or booster dose, it will not automatically reflect on your digital verification record. You will need to start over in the <1>Digital COVID-19 Verification Record</1> system to retrieve a new QR code. </0><1> We recommend waiting 3-7 days for your new dose to show up in the Immunization Registry.</1>
faqpage.06question: When will my vaccine dose be available in my digital verification record?
faqpage.06answer: Clinics vary in the length of time it takes to submit dose information to the Immunization Registry. We recommend waiting 3-7 days for your dose to show up in the system. If your record is still not located, you may <1>contact us</1>.
faqpage.07question: What if my record is not found?
faqpage.07answer:
<0>Your vaccine provider submits your vaccination record to the Immunization Registry, but they may have provided information that's incomplete. So, it's likely we have your record, but not your correct information. For instance:<1><0>Mobile phone number or email address was not included or does not match<1>Name is spelled differently<2>Date of birth does not match
<2>To find your record, try re-entering your information with a different email or mobile number. If your record still isn’t found, contact your provider to update your vaccination record or <1>contact us to request a review of your record. You'll be notified of our findings and remediation actions within 2-3 weeks. <3> If you received your vaccination from a federal agency (like the Department of Defense, Indian Health Services or Veterans Affairs), you will need to contact those agencies for assistance with your vaccination.
faqpage.08question: What if my Digital Verification Record is incorrect?
faqpage.08answer: If the information on your Digital vaccine record is incorrect or missing a dose, has wrong dates or incorrect brand), you may need to correct or update your immunization record. You can contact your provider to update your record or <1>contact us</1>. You will be notified of our findings and remediation actions within 2-3 weeks.
faqpage.09question: How does the Digital COVID-19 Verification Record system work?
faqpage.09answer: The <1>Digital COVID-19 Verification Record</1> system draws COVID-19 records from the state’s immunization systems. Enter your name, date of birth, and an email or mobile phone number associated with your vaccination record, then create a four-digit PIN number. If the information you submitted matches the official record, you will receive a text or email with a link to your <3>Digital COVID-19 Verification Record</3>. Enter the PIN you created to view the record.
faqpage.10answer: <0>Yes. Filling out the form on the system does not provide instant access to your verification record. The link to the verification record requires a PIN that you create and is sent only to the mobile phone or email that is associated with your immunization record. </0><1>The QR code is a SMART Health Card, a secure copy of your verification record. More information is at <1>https://smarthealth.cards</1>. To protect your privacy, the QR code can only be scanned and read by a SMART Health Card-compliant device. </1>
faqpage.11answer: <0>Yes. You have 24 hours from the time you receive the link to enter your four-digit PIN and access your <1>Digital COVID-19 Verification Record</1>. If you don't, the link to your digital record will expire, but you can start over and reset your PIN using the <3>Digital COVID-19 Verification Record</3> system. </0><1> If you can't remember your PIN, after 24 hours you can use the same process and create a new PIN.</1><2><0>NOTE: Once you've accessed your digital record and saved your QR code, it does not expire.</0></2>
faqpage.12question: Will this provide proof of my vaccine status?
faqpage.12answer: <0>Yes. It is one of <1>several options</1>  for providing your <3>Digital COVID-19 Verification Record</3> and can be printed or shown digitally. You may also show your CDC provided COVID-19 card or your state immunization record. </0><1>You are not required to obtain a <1>Digital COVID-19 Verification Record</1>. It is an optional means to obtain your COVID-19 verification information, and is the digital version of your paper verification record. It is one of the options to show proof of vaccination. The state will not be implementing a mandatory passport system.</1>
faqpage.13question: What if I need to replace my vaccination card?
faqpage.13answer: The system provides a digital copy of your verification record. If you’ve lost your paper verification record, you may print out your digital record and use it. If you lose your <1>Digital COVID-19 Verification Record</1>, you can start the process over on the system.
faqpage.14question: What happens to my information after I share it?
faqpage.14answer: Your <1>Digital COVID-19 Verification Record</1> shows the same information as your paper CDC vaccine card. You can ask organizations that will scan the QR code in your <3>Digital COVID-19 Verification Record</3> how they will use your data or if they will keep it. Only you can decide how and when to share your record.
faqpage.15question: What if I made multiple vaccination appointments for multiple people with a single phone number?
faqpage.15answer: If you are a parent or guardian and have created multiple appointments with a single phone number or email, enter the requests one at a time to receive separate links for each verification record.
faqpage.needhelpcontent01: For questions and other assistance, contact:
faqpage.needhelpcontent06: <0>NOTE</0>: We're unable to update your Digital COVID-19 Verification Record over the phone.
